summary: This document appears to be a text message or email exchange from August 11, 2019, discussing the chaotic aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The sender, likely a staff member, mentions being on shift that morning and dealing with media and hospital logistics.

persons.name: Tom
persons.context: Appears to be the sender of the message, discussing activities related to Epstein's death and hospital logistics.

events.title: Epstein's Death Aftermath
events.description: The sender references activities from the previous day related to Epstein's death, including going to the hospital to manage media and staff.

events.title: Staff Reflection on Shift
events.description: A staff member (Tom) reflects on being on shift the morning of Epstein's death, describing it as chaotic and a 'shit show'.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The correspondence is dated August 11, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
A staff member describes the morning of Epstein's death as chaotic and a 'shit show'.
The sender mentions going to the hospital to ensure staff weren't bothered by media while Epstein's body was there.
